moon

Class Academy

  • java.lang.Object
    • moon.Academy
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class Academy
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    Class that stores all the information of the academy. It also contains a static variable, moonApp, that is the singleton of our architecture. It also has defined teacher credentials: Email: tea.cher@edu.es Password: IsALotOfWork13579
    Author:
    Juan Riera and Lucia Asencio
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      java.util.HashSet<User> getUsers() 
      int loadUsers(java.lang.String txt)
      This function reads a file with users and add them to the app Format: name;surname;e.m@i.l;id;pwd; Substr before first ; is the name, substr between 2º and 3º is surname, substr between 3º and 4º is email, ..., and end with a ; after 5 attributes For the email to be readable, it must have 2 '.' and one '@' that has to be between the two '.'

      • loadUsers

        public int loadUsers(java.lang.String txt)
              throws java.lang.NumberFormatException,
                     java.io.IOException
        This function reads a file with users and add them to the app Format: name;surname;e.m@i.l;id;pwd; Substr before first ; is the name, substr between 2º and 3º is surname, substr between 3º and 4º is email, ..., and end with a ; after 5 attributes For the email to be readable, it must have 2 '.' and one '@' that has to be between the two '.'
        Parameters:
        txt - file
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        java.lang.NumberFormatException
